bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Walker et al. Summary of Case
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: A.H. Thompson: Conductor: sworn: testifies can solemnly assert that man was laying down: and emotionless upon track before engine struck him: saw him but did not know it was a man: saw dog run aside from track: was upon Engine at the time: Engine was backing and pulling can after it: returned with other train hands and sound body: W Kirkbride returned to city to notify authorities and I wen t on with the train: was after two o'clock__

Wm H. Bowman. Sworn: testifies: know deceased: his name was Wm Lockwood: was a painter by trade: saw him last evening between 7 & 8 pm: He was not intoxicated at that time: Have had one or two conversations with him regarding the Walkers: told him that he'd better keep away from Walkers as was bath to get into trouble he told me that the Walkers the watching from because they suspected him of being intimate with Mrs Walker__ and I understood him to say that such was the case__

Helen Walker: am I sworn: am the wife of M.A. Walker reside on A.R. new where Mr Lockwood was killed: I last about 12 o'cl last night when he left my house with Miss Emma Arnold intending to take her home: she resides with Mrs Hunter her sister on C. St: had a few friends visiting me last night
